Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: We need to produce event log table suitable for process mining. Must include Case ID, Activity Name, Timestamp, maybe other attributes. We need to explain logic and provide event log. We need to transform raw low-level actions into higher-level activities e.g. Read Document, Edit Document, Reply Email, Highlight Text, Update Spreadsheet, Switch Context, etc.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Define cases: Likely each logical work session around a document or email. Could treat each distinct document editing sequence as a case. For example: Case 1: Editing Document1.docx Quarterly Report includes focusing Word, typing intro, save, switch to email, read/compose email, reply, etc. But also later they return to same doc.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Cases could be per document or per email composition/review. But the instructions: case can represent a logical unit of user work, such as editing a specific document, handling a particular email, or reviewing a certain PDF. So we can define multiple cases: Case A: Quarterly_Report.docx editing session first part Case B: Email handling reading and replying Case C: Review PDF Report_Draft.pdf Case D: Budget spreadsheet update Case E: Return to Quarterly_Report.docx to add executive summary

Name: Backtracking - IND
Text: One approach: Use the Focus events to start a new case? Actually FOCUS indicates focusing on an application/window. Could treat each focus as start of a new case or continue previous. However they also have SWITCH events between apps; that may change case. Simplify: Well assign case IDs based on distinct document names or email thread. For each unique document/window they interact with, we create a case identifier.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Use SWITCH as case boundary? Or use Focus events to start new case when focusing on a different document/window. Simplify: Well assign case IDs based on the Window attribute document name. So each unique window gets its own case for the duration of interaction. However there are multiple interactions with same window Document1.docx appears twice. Could treat each distinct session as separate case.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Case 1: Document1.docx first session events 2-5 focus, typing, typing, save. Case 2: Email handling events 6-11 switch to email, click open, scroll, click reply, typing, click send. Case 3: PDF review events 12-14 switch to PDF, scroll, highlight. Case 4: Excel budget update events 15-18 focus Excel, typing updates, save. Case 5: Return to Document1.docx and add reference events 19-22 switch back, typing, save, close. Case 6: Final editing of Quarterly_Report.docx events 23-26 focus, typing, save, close.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: FOCUS Activate Application TYPING Enter Text SAVE Save Document SWITCH Switch Application CLICK Interact with UI SCROLL Scroll Document HIGHLIGHT Highlight Text CLOSE Close Document. Thats straightforward.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Event 1: FOCUS Window=Quarterly_Report.docx Activity Activate Application. Case ID? Could be C6 since its part of final editing of Quarterly_Report. But its earlier; but we can still assign to C6 as part of that case.
